DataElement.preferredName: Chemotherapy Prior Systemic Clinical Study Malignant Neoplasm Administration Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was prior administration of chemotherapeutic agents, synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment, for the current study cancer, a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chemotherapy Prior Systemic Clinical Study Malignant Neoplasm Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the prior administration of chemotherapeutic agents, synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment, for the current study cancer, a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Property.preferredName: Prior Systemic Clinical Study Malignant Neoplasm Administration
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:(sis-TEM-ik) Affecting the entire body.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
